instruction: In the research on on-line quality monitoring and defects classification in welding processes, what kinds of spectrum was used?
Output: In the research on on-line quality monitoring and defects classification in welding processes, the researchers used plasma radiation spectrum.

instruction: In the research on on-line quality monitoring and defects classification in welding processes, what spectral feature processing methods were used?
Output: The research used spectral feature processing methods such as selecting sensitive emission lines and extracting features of spectral data's evolution.

instruction: In the research on on-line quality monitoring and defects classification in welding processes, what metric was chosen and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen in the research for on-line quality monitoring and defects classification in welding processes was plasma electron temperature (Te). This metric can provide information on welding quality and can also be used to monitor welding seam formation and correlate with penetration depth.

instruction: In the research on on-line quality monitoring and defects classification in welding processes, what machine learning algorithms were used for automatic detection and classification of welding defects?
Output: In the research on on-line quality monitoring and defects classification in welding processes, the machine learning algorithms used for automatic detection and classification of welding defects were Artificial Neural Network (ANN) and Support Vector Machine (SVM).

instruction: Can the proposed method for on-line quality monitoring and defects classification in welding processes using feature extraction and machine learning algorithms be applied to other industries or processes beyond welding?
